result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan C. Olivarez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • False Imprisonment [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription, or drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner they are prescribed.  Inform Agent of all prescriptions.

Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.  No dangerous weapons (e.g. knives, firearms, etc)  Exception - Defendant my use his tools for his trade.

No contact with the victim listed in Criminal Complaint.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation ordered in Count 2.

With Huber.  Standard release conditions.  The first 3 months to commence on 7/15/2022 by 5:00 pm.  The 3 month balance are to be Stayed, for Agents use.  Court grants 3 days credit.
7/26/22 **THE FIRST 3 MONTHS TO COMMENCE ON 07/25/22

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 9:17 AM 
District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Ryan C. Olivarez in court with attorney Benjamin Wallis Lutgen.
Victim Witness Representative appeared in court.
Victim appeared in court.
Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.
Count 1 is dismissed and read-in.
Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to Counts 2 and 3.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of Counts 2 and 3.
State makes sentencing recommendations.
Defense makes sentencing recommendations.
Defendant makes statements.

COUNT 2
Court orders the following:
9 MONTHS JAIL STRAIGHT TIME
SENTENCE IS STAYED.

Term of Probation:  2 YEARS
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended
Absolute Sobriety, Random U.A.s
No Use of Possession of alcohol or controlled substances w/o valid RX, or drug paraphernalia
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any assessment, evaluation, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent
No contact with: victim
No Dangerous Weapons (e.g. Knives, firearms, etc.) - exception is he may use his tools for his trade

COSTS:  $268.00
DOMESTIC ABUSE SURCHARGE:  $100.00
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $ 250.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Body Armour warnings given.


COUNT 3
Court orders the following:
TOTAL SENTENCE 6 MONTHS HUBER (standard release conditions)
THE FIRST 3 MONTHS to commence on 7-15-2022 by 5:00 p.m.  
**Corrected on 07-26-2022:  THE FIRST 3 MONTHS to commence on 7-25-2022 by 5:00 p.m. (mjs)  
THE BALANCE of 3 MONTHS are to be STAYED for Agent's Use.
Credit time 3-days.

COSTS:  $243.00
DOMESTIC ABUSE SURCHARGE:  $100.00
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $200.00 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation under Count 2.
